name: Hamza
bio: Can you think about it? Then I will probably try to code it! Computers are these incredible things that, through code, you can completely control, directly transferring your ideas from your brain to the CPU, translating your imagination into intricate works of precision and efficiency. And that's what I love doing.

name: Pim
bio: I’ve loved puzzles my whole life, from crosswords to chess challenges. When I first encountered programming, it was love at first sight. I love working in a team where everyone can get the best out of themselves, and I’m always willing to help someone.

name: Jan
bio: Programming combines three of my favourite things: solving puzzles, working creatively and helping people get things done. The last part is best done, in my opinion, by striving for quality and having an eye for detail.

name: Ishan
tagline: “Talk is cheap, show me the code”
bio: While I’m fascinated by all things technological, what I enjoy the most is creating technology. My standard question for every problem that needs solving is “Where is the code, Ishan?” Let’s go!

name: Martijn
bio: I get a kick out of making beautiful things that also work under pressure. When you’re doing that with a team of programmers with the same passion, it doesn’t really feel like work.

name: Casper
bio: Numbers are nothing more than a concept in the human mind. They still form the basis for the endless stream of data that influences our daily lives. It’s fascinating what you can achieve by analysing this stream of human thoughts.

name: David
bio: To me, nothing is more wonderful than software that’s well put together and users are fully satisfied with. At Codestar, I can make sure every piece of software achieves this goal.

name: Donovan
tagline: “You must be the change you wish to see in the world.”

name: Steven
tagline: The devil is in the details
bio: Mastering complexity is the biggest challenge when developing large software systems, from the system as a whole to the smallest building blocks. When you work in a team, human complexity is added to the equation. The potential to create something truly beautiful lies at the intersection of these two aspects.

name: Martin
tagline: That's not a bug, that's a feature!
bio: Always curious about new technologies, programming languages, frameworks, gadgets and other innovations.

name: Werner
bio: Code not only tells the computer what to do, but it is also telling another human being what you want the computer to do. There are many ways of telling the computer to do something; how you do it matters. I believe that the code you write should reflect how you think about the problem you are trying to solve, so that others can follow along and understand your thought process when reading your code. This way, we can leave clients with a codebase they are proud of and are happy to work on.

name: Martin
bio: As an experienced front-end developer you'll be at home at Codestar. Working with a modern stack (e.g. functional reactive JavaScript), surrounded by colleagues who are as passionate as you are, and in a friendly and open environment.

name: Eelco
bio: I often try to understand how things are put together. How the world works. The best part of custom-made software is that it gives you all the freedom to make a model of the reality of users and clients. Once that model has the right balance between simplicity and complexity, it’s wonderful. The code is understandable and the functionality is aligned with the needs.

name: Pavels
tagline: “A programmer is not a human but the new creature”

name: Asif
tagline: Scala is the way to go

name: Nathan
tagline: “Learn as if you were to live forever.”
bio: I always want to know how things work and why they work the way they do. What better way to know, than building it yourself?

name: Mozart
tagline: “If it doesn't challenge you it won't change you”

name: Nick
tagline: let types = your guide in software
bio: Types are the best kind of documentation. If you can understand a system just by looking at its types, you have a well designed system.

name: David
bio: I enjoy helping businesses improve their communication and business understanding by developing successful data-driven solutions.
